item.title: An Interlude in Shanghai
item.description: The following is excerpted from “James Krenov: Leave Fingerprints,” by Brendan Bernhardt Gaffney.  After years of research and more than 150 interviews, Gaffney produced a definitive biography of Krenov, featuring historical documents, press clippings and hundreds of historical photographs. Gaffney traced Krenov’s life from his birth in a small village in far-flung Russia, to China,...

item.title: For Sale: Comb-back in Elm, Sycamore & Oak
item.description: This seven-stick comb-back is Katherine’s first apprenticeship chair, which we built together while teaching a class last week. It’s set up for lounging, with back sticks that rake 20° back and a seat tilt for lounging.   Like all stick chairs, this one bears imperfections that mark how it was made. The leg angles are not...

item.title: Bass Guitar Build Pt7
item.description:
The neck’s done, so in this video the body shaping is completed and a few other bits sorted out!

Cheers Gary
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Gary Nava, Luthier)

item.title: Losses to the Craft: Mike Wenzloff & Charles Hummel
item.description: Recently we’ve lost two important contributors to our craft: sawmaker Mike Wenzloff and historian Charles Hummel. I knew Mike fairly well, and I met Charlie in person only once. But both people made an indelible mark on me. Mike Wenzloff was a pioneering sawmaker. During the early 2000s, Mike began making incredible handsaws and backsaws...

item.title: Free Cotton Conversion Chart (Because I’m a Dolt)
item.description: I made a mistake when ordering 500 printed cotton conversion charts that translate fractions to decimal to metric. The print job is crisp. The numbers are correct. But I speced the wrong weight of cotton. These are thinner than I intended. They’re perfectly fine – just not what I envisioned. So instead of recycling them,...

item.title: Introduction to Leg Angles
item.description: The following is excerpted from “The Anarchist’s Design Book,” by Christopher Schwarz. The new, expanded edition of “The Anarchist’s Design Book” is an exploration of furniture forms that have persisted outside of the high styles that dominate every museum exhibit, scholarly text and woodworking magazine of the last 200 years. There are historic furniture forms...

item.title: Bass Guitar Build Pt 6
item.description:
With the fretboard/frets completed, the next stage is to shape the neck.

Cheers Gary
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Gary Nava, Luthier)

item.title: Heading to Australia One Last Time
item.description: Next Friday, Lucy and I fly to Australia for a week of relaxation and marsupials. And then I’ll stay on to teach a couple chairmaking classes for Wood Dust and participate in some woodworking events that look to be fun. The two classes have been sold out for months, but the organizers have found a...

item.title: Setting the Record Straighter. No – Sharper. ‘The Chairmaker’s Workshop’
item.description: One of the rewards for running a publishing company is getting to say “yes” when other people wouldn’t even know to say “no.” Two summers ago, chairmaker Chris Williams and I visited Drew and Louise Langsner in their home outside Marshall, North Carolina. And as we were sitting there, being feasted upon by bugs (as...

item.title: Pocket Book Preview: ‘Make Fresh Milk Paint’
item.description: As I write this, we’re awaiting proofs on our latest pocket book, “Make Fresh Milk Paint,” by Nick Kroll. Nick was in one of Christopher Schwarz’s Germany classes this summer, and he showed up with a hand-bound book about making milk paint in your kitchen. Chris sent an email to Kara Gebhart Uhl (she handles...

item.title: Interview With ‘Wood by Wright’
item.description: Two weeks ago, James Wright and his daughter Melody visited Lost Art Press to do a video tour and interview. James – aka Wood by Wright – is one of the important people who are keeping hand tool woodworking alive on the internet. (Also important in my book: Rex Krueger.) I love both these guys...

item.title: Bass Guitar Build Pt 5
item.description: Now is the time to prepare the fretboard (compound radius etc.), install the frets and dress them. This isn’t the most exciting stage of the build but of course frets are pretty essential to any fretted instrument!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Gary Nava, Luthier)

item.title: No Steambox? No Problem
item.description: In their efforts to make chairmaking more accessible, Alexander Brothers in Virginia now offers steambent arms and armbows that will work with all the armchairs in “The Stick Chair Book” (a free download) and the Hobbit chair in The Stick Chair Journal No. 2. You can get the bent components in red oak or cherry....

item.title: This Week: Handmade ATC Mugs
item.description: To mark the release of the revised edition of “The Anarchist’s Tool Chest,” we asked the artists at SKT Ceramics in Cincinnati to design a large porcelain coffee mug in the company’s signature green-blue celadon glaze. We are offering 100 of these handmade 12-ounce mugs. Each is stamped on the underside by SKT and signed...
